alert.note: Alert for Susquehanna (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 16 at 8:29PM EST until January 17 at 1:00PM EST by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT FROM 8 AM TO 1 PM EST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Mixed precipitation expected. Total snow and sleet accumulations of less than a half inch and ice accumulations of a light glaze. * WHERE...In New York, Broome county. In Pennsylvania, Susquehanna county. * WHEN...From 8 AM to 1 PM EST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Temperatures will fall well below freezing tonight, allowing precipitation to begin as a wintry mix including freezing rain. Precipitation will change to rain as warmer air moves in, but glazing may continue a little longer as ground temperatures will lag behind air temperatures.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1. The Pennsylvania Department of Transportation and Pennsylvania Turnpike Commission remind motorist to adjust speeds based on driving conditions as winter weather impacts Pennsylvania roadways. Visit www.511pa.com for the latest travel, roadways, and traffic conditions.
